oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-09-25 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 25, 1943. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (announcer), Whitey Ford/the Duke Of Paducah (as host and performer respectively) and performers Curley Williams and his Georgia Peach Pickers, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, Minnie Pearl, Ford Rush, and Mac McGar. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Duke Of Paducah; Mac McGar; Curley Williams; Georgia Peach Pickers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Trudy Brown interviews service men [continued from part 1] -- Take Me Back To Tulsa (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- Louie Buck introduces the Duke Of Paducah -- Comedy routine (Duke Of Paducah) -- Katy Hill (Mac McGar) -- Prince Albert commercial (Whitey Ford, Louie Buck) -- Whitey Ford introduces Curley Williams and his Georgia Peach Pickers -- Home In San Antone (Curley Williams and his Georgia Peach Pickers) -- Whitey Ford introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- Ida Red (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- Closing statement (Whitey Ford) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Minnie Pearl; Rush, Ford, 1895-; McGar, Mac; Williams, Curley, 1913-1970; Georgia Peach Pickers (Musical group); Smith, Hal, 1923-2008; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986
